message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the development of a framework for programming social robots or collaborative robots that interact with people in a reactive way. This involves using a Learning from Demonstration (LfD) technique to map motion capture of humans directly to a Playful script. The paper also discusses the use of Hidden Markov Models (HMMs) and binary classifiers to identify sensory-motor couplings and cluster them into a hierarchical tree structure. These topics are all related to robotics (cs.RO), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), human-computer interaction (cs.HC), machine learning (cs.LG), and computer vision (cs.CV).
